title: ET AI Conclave: Where India’s AI leaders converge
summary: India’s artificial intelligence moment is no longer theoretical; it is unfolding in real time across boardrooms, startups, policy corridors, and enterprise war rooms. The decisions being made today around AI adoption, governance, infrastructure, and scale will determine which organizations lead the next decade and which fall behind. At the center of this pivotal moment stands the ET AI Conclave and Awards 2025, an event designed not merely to observe India’s AI transformation but to actively shape it. full_text:
India’s artificial intelligence moment is no longer theoretical; it is unfolding in real time across boardrooms, startups, policy corridors, and enterprise war rooms. The decisions being made today around AI adoption, governance, infrastructure, and scale will determine which organizations lead the next decade and which fall behind. At the center of this pivotal moment stands the ET AI Conclave and Awards 2025, an event designed not merely to observe India’s AI transformation but to actively shape it. title: MoD inks ₹2,312 crore HAL deal for 8 Dornier jets
summary: The Ministry of Defence has signed a contract with Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL), Transport Aircraft Division, Kanpur, for the acquisition of eight Dornier 228 Aircraft along with Operational Role Equipment for the Indian Coast Guard (ICG) at a cost of Rs 2,312 crore under the Buy (Indian) category. title: CEA: New CPI to improve policy framework
summary: Chief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran on Thursday said the new Consumer Price Index (CPI) series will improve the quality of data used for monetary and fiscal policy decisions. The National Statistics Office released the CPI with Base 2024=100, updating the basket to include more goods and services while removing items no longer widely consumed. title: US planning more defence sales to India: Official
summary: The U.S. aims to expand defense sales to India, viewing it as a vital strategic partner. A recently signed ten-year defense framework and trade deal are set to deepen bilateral ties, improve interoperability, and boost American jobs through potential weapons system purchases and energy agreements. title: What economists have to say about January CPI
summary: India's inflation rate rose to 2.75% in January. This marks the first time it has returned to the central bank's target band since August. The new data series shows higher food and precious metal prices. Experts believe inflation will edge higher gradually. The Reserve Bank of India is expected to keep interest rates on hold for an extended period. title: India fines Intel ₹27.38 cr over warranty issues
summary: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) has fined Intel Corporation ₹27.38 crore for its India-specific warranty policy on Boxed Microprocessors. The policy, effective April 25, 2016, allowed warranty claims in India only for products bought from authorised Indian distributors, redirecting claims from globally purchased processors to the country of purchase. (Catch all the Business News, Breaking News and Latest News Updates on The Economic Times.) Subscribe to The Economic Times Prime and read the ET ePaper online. (Catch all the Business News, Breaking News and Latest News Updates on The E
full_text:
The Competition Commission of India (CCI) has fined Intel Corporation ₹27.38 crore for its India-specific warranty policy on Boxed Microprocessors. The policy, effective April 25, 2016, allowed warranty claims in India only for products bought from authorised Indian distributors, redirecting claims from globally purchased processors to the country of purchase. title: Naravane memoir leak probe widens
summary: Delhi Police are investigating a potential leak of former Army chief Gen M.M. Naravane's memoir. The probe suggests a coordinated effort to bypass defence ministry clearance. A criminal conspiracy charge has been added to the FIR. The publisher, Penguin Random House India, is being questioned about the book's origin and distribution. The memoir has reportedly appeared on international markets.  How pension funds flow into equity ETFs skewing markets Can Mahindra’s playbook scale up this big boy of school buses? title: India to act if Trump's remarks on PM Modi verified
summary: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) said it has not seen any video of US President Donald Trump’s remark about Prime Minister Modi, in which he reportedly said he “doesn’t want to destroy his political career.” MEA spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal added that “whether it is true or false, we will take appropriate action on it.” Listen to this article in summarized format Unlock AI Briefing and Premium Content    How pension funds flow into equity ETFs skewing markets Can Mahindra’s playbook scale up this big boy of school buses? title: Swedish Jets to guard high north in NATO mission
summary: Sweden is joining NATO's Arctic Sentry mission. Swedish Gripen fighter jets will patrol near Iceland and Greenland. This move aims to boost NATO's presence in the Arctic. The mission seeks to ensure stability and protect shared interests in this vital region. It also addresses tensions concerning U.S. interest in Greenland. title: LS clears Industrial Relations Code (Amendment) Bill
summary: The Lok Sabha has approved the Industrial Relations Code (Amendment) Bill, 2026. Union Labour Minister Mansukh Mandaviya introduced the amendment. It was placed on the supplementary agenda after Question Hour. This development occurred during the ongoing Budget session of Parliament. The bill's passage marks a significant legislative event. title: AAI allocates Rs 3,490 crores for air navigation infra
summary: Airports Authority of India will invest Rs 3,490 crore to upgrade air navigation systems. This includes Rs 1,532 crore for automating air traffic management. The modernization aims to handle increasing air traffic. AAI is also strengthening its cybersecurity framework. Recruitment is ongoing to ensure adequate technical staff. title: Housing sales for 15 tier-II cities decline 10%
summary: According to PropEquity the housing sales of 15 tier-II cities dropped 10% last year to 1.56 lakh units, while remained flat in value terms at Rs 1.48 lakh crore. Samir Jasuja, Founder and CEO of PropEquity said the dounturn is largely linked to a scarcity of affordable homes under Rs 1 crore. Housing sales flat at Rs 1.48 lakh cr last yr in 15 tier-II cities, 10% dip in volumes, according to PropEquity  (Catch all the Business News, Breaking News and Latest News Updates on The Economic Times.) title: AI to slow IT growth, not kill the model: Agarwal
summary: Indian IT services firms face a growth slowdown due to Artificial Intelligence. AI tools reduce project effort, impacting billing. Large IT firms expect 5-6% revenue growth, while mid-cap firms anticipate 10-12%. Contract renewals may lead to pricing cuts. India's position as the world's software factory remains secure. Valuations may need adjustment in this new growth environment.  AI won't kill IT services: Ashi Anand on why market overreacted to tech selloff Anthropic’s Claude 'digital coworker' sparks new anxiety in the $250-billion IT services industry Agentic AI breaking IT’s billing mod

Indian IT services firms face a growth slowdown due to Artificial Intelligence. AI tools reduce project effort, impacting billing. Valuations may need adjustment in this new growth environment. title: Yes vote may stall B'desh's constitutional continuity
summary: A referendum on a complex reform package by Muhammad Yunus' interim government is underway. Experts warn this could end the continuity of Bangladesh's 1972 Constitution. The vote seeks public consent for the 'July National Charter 2025'. If passed, the next parliament will be obligated to implement these reforms.  ‘Stormed, abused, threatened’: Rijiju shares video of Parliament clash Trump derailed Indo-US relations! US Rep exposes President Bangladesh: End of Begum vs Begum battle, now it's Rahman vs Rahman UNSC flags Pakistani terror group Jaish role in Red Fort terror attack M&M Q3 FY26 PAT
full_text: A referendum on a complex reform package by Muhammad Yunus' interim government is underway. Experts warn this could end the continuity of Bangladesh's 1972 Constitution. The vote seeks public consent for the 'July National Charter 2025'. If passed, the next parliament will be obligated to implement these reforms.  ‘Stormed, abused, threatened’: Rijiju shares video of Parliament clash Trump derailed Indo-US relations! US Rep exposes President Bangladesh: End of Begum vs Begum battle, now it's Rahman vs Rahman UNSC flags Pakistani terror group Jaish role in Red Fort terror attack M&M Q3 FY26 PAT soars 38% GST even after death! FM Sitharaman blasts TMC MP over fake claims Trump says 'nothing definitive' reached after meeting with Netanyahu Hardeep Singh Puri recalls Rahul Gandhi's 'Wink'... Rahul vs Rijiju: Centre to move privilege notice against LoP Rahul Gandhi questions why Anil Ambani isn't in jail... title: IT's bleeding: Sensex slumps 600 pts, ₹2.8 lkh cr gone
summary: Indian stock markets, Sensex and Nifty, experienced a sharp decline today. This downturn was driven by concerns over U.S. jobs data, which reduced expectations for early interest rate cuts. The IT sector saw a significant sell-off due to new AI developments. HUL's weak quarterly results also contributed to the market's fall. full_text:
Indian stock markets, Sensex and Nifty, experienced a sharp decline today. This downturn was driven by concerns over U.S. jobs data, which reduced expectations for early interest rate cuts. The IT sector saw a significant sell-off due to new AI developments. HUL's weak quarterly results also contributed to the market's fall.
